dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Kazakhstan's new tax law, Article 676, it's pretty straightforward, right? Like, just a simple declaration for residents, no biggie.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Kazakhstan's new tax law, Article six hundred seventy six, it's pretty straightforward, right? Like, just a simple declaration for residents, no biggie.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources and taxes withheld (paid) (the Certificate)... From the above it seems that this service is only available to non-residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, it's, um, anything but simple, and it applies to everyone, resident or not, Host_A. That's, that's a pretty big misunderstanding there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, it's, um, anything but simple, and it applies to everyone, resident or not, Host_A. That's, that's a pretty big misunderstanding there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From the above it seems that this service is only available to non-residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh. Right. Okay. So, what is this Certificate of Global Income, then? Sounds kinda intense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh. Right. Okay. So, what is this Certificate of Global Income, then? Sounds kinda intense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Article 676 of the Tax Code Certificate of Income received from Kazakhstan Sources and Taxes withheld (paid) states that: 1. A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is. It's a, uh, CGITC, detailing all your income from anywhere in the world. And I mean all, including crypto and, like, undeclared offshore accounts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. It's a, uh, C G I T C, detailing all your income from anywhere in the world. And I mean all, including crypto and, like, undeclared offshore accounts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources and taxes withheld (paid)...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, crypto? And offshore? How often do you, uh, have to submit that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, crypto? And offshore? How often do you, uh, have to submit that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Within three days of receiving any income, no matter how small. Seriously. To the Central Tax Authority.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Within three days of receiving any income, no matter how small. Seriously. To the Central Tax Authority.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under the above procedure, Certificates are generally received within 10 calendar days of an application or the required tax reporting being filed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Three days? That's insane! What if, like, you miss that deadline?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Three days? That's insane! What if, like, you miss that deadline?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Immediate asset freezes. And, uh, potential imprisonment. Yeah, they're not messing around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Immediate asset freezes. And, uh, potential imprisonment. Yeah, they're not messing around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain information about penalties for non-compliance, such as asset freezes or imprisonment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, they're really cracking down. But then, it says they want to be a 'premier global center for tax haven activity'? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, they're really cracking down. But then, it says they want to be a 'premier global center for tax haven activity'? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan aims to be among the 30 most developed countries in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, it's a twist, isn't it? They're aiming to attract investment, but with total transparency. Like, they have double tax treaties with 200 countries now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, it's a twist, isn't it? They're aiming to attract investment, but with total transparency. Like, they have double tax treaties with two hundred countries now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On top of that, Kazakhstan only has double tax treaties with 53 countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. And, um, I saw something about blockchain for certificates? Wasn't there, like, a scandal about forged ones for soccer players?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. And, um, I saw something about blockchain for certificates? Wasn't there, like, a scandal about forged ones for soccer players?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article does not mention blockchain. It includes a heading '8 Soccer Players At The World Cup Who Have Been Caught Up In Tax Scandals' but the subsequent text does not describe any such scandal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, yes. The blockchain is the new system, ensuring integrity. The forging, that was, uh, before this. The Ministry of Finance did that then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, yes. The blockchain is the new system, ensuring integrity. The forging, that was, uh, before this. The Ministry of Finance did that then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not mention blockchain technology or any involvement of the Ministry of Finance in forging documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so they cleaned that up. But, uh, foreign nationals are automatically tax-resident now? And a 'Tax Tsar'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so they cleaned that up. But, uh, foreign nationals are automatically tax-resident now? And a 'Tax Tsar'?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When tax authority employees hand out returns manually, all foreign nationals are treated automatically as non-residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. No complex assessments needed anymore. And if that 'Tax Tsar' doesn't approve your reconciliation, you, uh, you get a midnight visit from the tax police.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. No complex assessments needed anymore. And if that 'Tax Tsar' doesn't approve your reconciliation, you, uh, you get a midnight visit from the tax police.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From this, we can ascertain that the issue is not yet fully regulated within the tax authorities and approaches tend to differ depending on the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Midnight visit? And someone called Madina Abisheva, she views non-compliance as... treason?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Midnight visit? And someone called Madina Abisheva, she views non-compliance as... treason?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Madina Abisheva, Tax and Legal Department

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's her. Chief Tax Enforcer. And yes, treason. It's, um, led to a 400% increase in tax revenue, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's her. Chief Tax Enforcer. And yes, treason. It's, um, led to a four hundred percent increase in tax revenue, though.
